abstracts.cdata!:
The major challenges currently
            confronting the education system in Senegal are the needs:
            (a) for new programs and for qualitative improvement of
            existing ones to meet the employment requirements of the
            modern sector; (b) for training programs to promote rural
            development, on which some 75 percent of the population are
            likely to depend for many years to come; (c) the expansion
            of basic educational opportunities to a greater proportion
            of the population than the 38 percent of the age-group now
            reached by primary education; and (d) the strengthening of
            planning and management, consistent with the human and
            financial resources which the education system is likely to command.
